data.title: Jules Verne
data.text:
1901 Les Enfants du Capitaine Grant

France, Production: Charles Pathé, 50 m (meters?)

Director: Ferdinand Zecca

[Dec?]: Lucien Heilbronn 1902 Le Voyage dans la Lune (IMDB)

France, Production: Star-Film George Melies, 285 m/16 minutes (30 scenes)

Source: Inspired by De la Terre a la Lune and First Men in the Moon (H. G. Wells) 1903 Voyage of the Arctic or How Captain Kettle Discovered the North Pole (IMDB)

AKA: The Trip on the Arctic (Great Britain)

Production: Robert William Paul

Inspired by Aventures du Capitaine Hatteras 1904 Un Drame dans les Airs

France, Production: Ferdinand Zecca, Pathe-Films, 300m Le Voyage a Travers L'Impossible

France, Production: Star-Film George Melies, 374 m/24 minutes (40 scenes)

Source: Based on the Play by Jules Verne and Adolphe d'Ennery 1905 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea

USA, Production: Wallace McCutcheon, Biograph, b/w, 18 min

Director: Wallace McCutcheon 1906 Le Voyage dans la Lune

France, Production: Gaumont, Alice Guy (supervision) 1907 20,000 Lieues sous les Mers ou Le Cauchemar d'un Pecheur (IMDB)

20,000 Lieues sous les Mers

France, Production: Star-Film Georges Melies, 450 m (30 scenes)

Source: not really related to a Verne novel except the title 1908 The Airship/Hundred Years Hence

USA, Production: Vita Co.

Source: Inspired by Robur le Conquerant Michael Strogoff

USA, Production: Essanay-Film Co

Director: Gilbert-Max Anderson 1909 Voyage au Centre de la Terre

France, Production: Charles Pathe, 9 minutes Vers le Pole Sud (a Serial)

France, Production: Gaumont

Director: George Wague

Source: Inspired by Aventures du Capitaine Hatteras The Airship Destroyer/Aerial Torpedo (IMDB)

AKA: Battle in the Clouds(USA)

Great Britain, Production: Charles Urban Trading Co., 1350 ft

Source: Inspired by Robur le Conquerant 1910 Aerial Submarine - Piracy in Sea and in Air

Great Britain, Production: Kineto, 750 ft

Source: Inspired by Robur le Conquerant Michael Strogoff (IMDB)

Source: Inspired by Robur le Conquerant The Aerial Anarchists

Great Britain, Production: Robert W. Paul, 15 minutes

Source: Inspired by Robur le Conquerant 1912 La Conquete du Pole

France, Production: Star-Film Paris, George Melies, 20 minutes (40 scenes)

Source: Inspired by Aventures du Capitaine Hatteras 1913 Die Reise um die Welt oder Die Jagd Nach der Hunert Pfundnote

Germany, Production: Karl Werner, Berlin, 2021 m (6 acts)

Source: A mixture of Tour de Monde en 80 Jours and an allusion to Captain Nemo Les Enfants du Capitaine Grant

France, Production: Eclair-Films

Notes: this film was never completed, but possibly parts were used in following movie 1913-14 Les Enfants du Capitaine Grant

France, Production: Eclair-Films

Notes: No. 1 in a series "Les films Jules Verne", 1950 m (6 acts) 1914 Michael Strogoff

Cast:

Allen Holubar, Jane Gail, Matt Moore, Lois Alexander, Dan Hanlon, Edna Pendleton, William Welsh, Curtis Benton, Howard Crampton, Wallace Clark

Notes: Loose adaptation of 20,000 Leagues...

/ The Isle of Zorda France, Silent, Production: Louis Nalpas, Nice/Union-Eclair, 2400 m (9 episodes)

Chapter titles: 1) Lost in Space 2) Sinister Savages 3) Savage Justice 4) Wild Man at Large 5) Trail of the Mystery Man 6) The Pirates Attack 7) Menace of the Mercurians 8) Between Two Fires! 9) Shrine of the Silver Bird 10) Fighting Fury! 11) Desperate Chances 12) Mystery of the Mine 13) Jungle Deadfall 14) Men from Tomorrow 15) The Last of Mysterious Island

Notes: A "fantastic" adaption that included pirates, cannibals, and a princess from Mercury
